section.title: Configuring Applications by Using the OpenAM Console
section.para: This section describes the process of creating applications, which are used as templates for policies protecting a web site or web application, using the OpenAM console.

procedure.title: To Configure an Application by Using the Policy Editor

step.para: In the OpenAM console, select Access Control > Realm Name > Policies.
To create a new application, click Add New Application.
To modify an existing application, in the row containing the application, click the Edit Application icon.
To discard any changes and return to the previous page, click Cancel.
Provide a name for the application, and optionally a description, and then click Next.
Define resource patterns that policies within this application use as the basis for their rules, by following the steps below:
In the Available patterns section, click the row containing an asterisk (*) to move the pattern to the Create your resources section.

mediaobject.alt: Move available starter patterns to the right of the screen to configure the resource patterns that policies in this application use.

textobject.para: Click the arrow to move the pattern to the right.

step.para: Optionally, in the Create your resources section, replace the asterisk with a pattern that the policies in the application use as a template for specifying resources.

mediaobject.alt: Create resource patterns, with optional wildcards, that policies in this application use.

step.para:
For information on specifying patterns that the policies use for matching resources, see
Specifying Resource Patterns with Wildcards.
Click the Add icon to move the pattern into the Resources section.

mediaobject.alt: Add the completed resource template to the Resources section by clicking the Add icon.

textobject.para: Add the resource pattern to the Resources section.

tip.para: To remove a resource pattern, click the Delete icon.

step.para: Repeat these steps to add all the resource patterns your policies may require, and then click Next.

tip.para: If the configuration is not visible, click the maximized link to switch to maximized view.

step.para: To make changes to the configuration, either click the step in the list, or click the item to amend in the Review Configuration and Finish section to jump to the relevant step, and make your changes.
When the configuration is complete, click Finish.

itemizedlist.para: To make use of the new application and any policies it contains, you must perform one of the following procedures:

listitem.para: Configure a policy agent to use the application for policy decisions.
For details see the procedure To Specify the Realm and Application for Policy Decisions.
Create a referral to the realm the application is in.
For details see the procedure To Enable Referrals in the Policy Editor.
